title.narrative: IR2 - CHILD FRIENDLY SERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: Children-in particular girls and marginalized groups in MDAG VDCs of DA CAW & Girls' Education districts and humanitarian crisis affected distr icts have increased access to child-friendly learning environment ( inc luding Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) facilities )as defined by the National Framework of the MoE/ DoE, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children \0096 will have increased equitable access to child friendly lear ning opportunities that are socially inclusive, conflict gender sensiti ve and social diversity.

participating-org.narrative: EKDARA GA PA GA KA PA OFFICE

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Digital learning materials and ICT in education
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children-in particular girls and marginalized groups in MDAG VDCs of DACAW & Girls' Education districts and humanitarian crisis affected districts have increased access to child-friendly learning environment ( including WASH facilities )as defined by the National Framework of the MoE/DoE
Number of schools having at least 3 child-friendly school indicators in 25 target districts
Percentage of of new entrants with ECD experience in Grade 1 (boys & girls & marginalized)

No. of schools with CGD friendly WASH facilities (safe water, latrines, solid and liquid waste, hand washing stations) and learning materials implemented by DoE contributing to fulfillment of minimum standards for a Child Friendly School
Number of out of school children in 8 Terai districts available
